text:
This is a 55 yo male who was dx with Burkets Lymphoma on [**2166-7-29**].
   He initially presented to his PCP with wt loss, night sweats, small
   bowel obstruction.  His symptoms worsened and included abd distention,
   dyspnea, fatigue, his plts were 20, HCT 22, at ths time he came to
   [**Hospital1 54**] for further workup.  Bone marrow bx was done, CT of abd showed a
   mass as it had at the outside hospital.   Yesterday he had a
   paracentesis and this morning he developed abd pain for which he was
   given morphine with some improvement in his pain.  He then became SOB
   with an 02 SAT of 77% on RA, he was transferred to the MICU for further
   care.
   Cancer (Malignant Neoplasm), Bone
   Assessment:
   Pt was emergently intubated on arrival.   He went to CT this morning to
   r/o an abd perf
 the CT was neg.  His abd became increasingly more
   distended through the day, he started to drop his BP this afternoon.
   His K was increasing through the day (7.2 last checked) and his lactate
   was rising as well (he had a high of 11 today).  His u/o has been
   dropping, he cont to spike temps through the day.
    Action:
   Pt was given 3 liters of NS and a unit of PRBC for his dropping BP but
   still required pressors
 levo was started and neo was added to try and
   maintain a mean BP of >60.  He was given kexalate, IV insulin, D50,
   sodium bicarb to try and correct his K.  Given antibiotics for his
   fever and his recent paracentesis.  Chemo was started this evening by
   the oncology nurses.
   Response:
   His K cont to rise, a dialysis cath was placed and he will start on
   CVVHD today, his pressors requirement conts to rise, no stool so far
   from the kexalate
   Plan:
   Follow K q1 hr, follow tumor lysis labs q3 hrs, CVVHD, EKG as needed to
   watch for peak Ts, u/o
   Abdominal pain (including abdominal tenderness)
   Assessment:
   Pt with a distended abd, c/o pain
   Action:
   Started on fent and versed for comfort
   Response:
   More comfortable on sedation
   Plan:
   Cont to titrate to comfort
   His wife has been in and out all day, very stressed and concerned.  SS
   is involved.
